alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 4:29PM EDT until further notice by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT/530 PM EDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend Florida and Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Liberty. In Panhandle Florida, Calhoun. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CDT /530 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 327 PM CDT /427 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blountstown, Bristol and Kennys Mill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
